trans-unit.source: Connect Excel to Hadoop with Power Query | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Connect Excel to Hadoop with Power Query | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to take advantage of business intelligence components and use Power Query for Excel to access data stored in Hadoop on HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to take advantage of business intelligence components and use Power Query for Excel to access data stored in Hadoop on HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: Connect Excel to Hadoop by using Power Query
trans-unit.target: Connect Excel to Hadoop by using Power Query

trans-unit.source: One key feature of the Microsoft big-data solution is the integration of Microsoft business intelligence (BI) components with Hadoop clusters in Azure HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: One key feature of the Microsoft big-data solution is the integration of Microsoft business intelligence (BI) components with Hadoop clusters in Azure HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: A primary example of this integration is the ability to connect Excel to the Azure Storage account that contains the data associated with your Hadoop cluster by using the Microsoft Power Query for Excel add-in.
trans-unit.target: A primary example of this integration is the ability to connect Excel to the Azure Storage account that contains the data associated with your Hadoop cluster by using the Microsoft Power Query for Excel add-in.

trans-unit.source: This article walks you through how to set up and use Power Query to query data associated with a Hadoop cluster managed with HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: This article walks you through how to set up and use Power Query to query data associated with a Hadoop cluster managed with HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: While the steps in this article can be used with either a Linux or Windows-based HDInsight cluster, Windows is required for the client workstation.
trans-unit.target: While the steps in this article can be used with either a Linux or Windows-based HDInsight cluster, Windows is required for the client workstation.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Before you begin this article, you must have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin this article, you must have the following:

trans-unit.source: An HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: An HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: To configure one, see <link><linkText>Get started with Azure HDInsight[hdinsight-get-started]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To configure one, see <link><linkText>Get started with Azure HDInsight[hdinsight-get-started]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: A workstation that is running Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 R2, or a later operating system.
trans-unit.target: A workstation that is running Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 R2, or a later operating system.

trans-unit.source: Office 2013 Professional Plus, Office 365 ProPlus, Excel 2013 Standalone, or Office 2010 Professional Plus.
trans-unit.target: Office 2013 Professional Plus, Office 365 ProPlus, Excel 2013 Standalone, or Office 2010 Professional Plus.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Install Microsoft Power Query for Excel
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Install Microsoft Power Query for Excel

trans-unit.source: Power Query can be used to import data from a variety of sources into Microsoft Excel, where it can power BI tools like PowerPivot and Power View.
trans-unit.target: Power Query can be used to import data from a variety of sources into Microsoft Excel, where it can power BI tools like PowerPivot and Power View.

trans-unit.source: In particular, Power Query can import data that has been output or that has been generated by a Hadoop job running on an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: In particular, Power Query can import data that has been output or that has been generated by a Hadoop job running on an HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Download Microsoft Power Query for Excel from the <link><linkText>Microsoft Download Center[powerquery-download]</linkText><title></title></link> and install it.
trans-unit.target: Download Microsoft Power Query for Excel from the <link><linkText>Microsoft Download Center[powerquery-download]</linkText><title></title></link> and install it.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Import HDInsight data into Excel
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Import HDInsight data into Excel

trans-unit.source: The Power Query add-in for Excel makes it easy to import data from your HDInsight cluster into Excel, where BI tools such as PowerPivot and Power Map can be used to inspect, analyze, and present the data.
trans-unit.target: The Power Query add-in for Excel makes it easy to import data from your HDInsight cluster into Excel, where BI tools such as PowerPivot and Power Map can be used to inspect, analyze, and present the data.

trans-unit.source: To import data from an HDInsight cluster
trans-unit.target: To import data from an HDInsight cluster

trans-unit.source: Open Excel.
trans-unit.target: Open Excel.

trans-unit.source: Create a new blank workbook.
trans-unit.target: Create a new blank workbook.

trans-unit.source: Click the Power Query menu, click From Other Sources, and then click From Azure HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Click the Power Query menu, click From Other Sources, and then click From Azure HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>HDI.PowerQuery.SelectHdiSource</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>HDI.PowerQuery.SelectHdiSource</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Note: If you don't see the Power Query menu, go to File > Options > Add-Ins, and select COM Add-ins from the drop-down Manage box at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Note: If you don't see the Power Query menu, go to File > Options > Add-Ins, and select COM Add-ins from the drop-down Manage box at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: Select the Go... button and verify that the box for the Power Query for Excel add-in has been checked.
trans-unit.target: Select the Go... button and verify that the box for the Power Query for Excel add-in has been checked.

trans-unit.source: For Account Name, enter the name of the Azure Blob storage account associated with your cluster, and then click OK.
trans-unit.target: For Account Name, enter the name of the Azure Blob storage account associated with your cluster, and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: For Account Key, enter the key for the Blob storage account, and then click Save.
trans-unit.target: For Account Key, enter the key for the Blob storage account, and then click Save.

trans-unit.source: (You need to do this only the first time you access this store.)
trans-unit.target: (You need to do this only the first time you access this store.)

trans-unit.source: In the Navigator pane on the left of the Query Editor, double-click the Blob storage container name.
trans-unit.target: In the Navigator pane on the left of the Query Editor, double-click the Blob storage container name.

trans-unit.source: By default, the container name is the same name as the cluster name.
trans-unit.target: By default, the container name is the same name as the cluster name.

trans-unit.source: Locate HiveSampleData.txt in the Name column (the folder path is ../hive/warehouse/hivesampletable/), and then click Binary on the left of HiveSampleData.txt.
trans-unit.target: Locate HiveSampleData.txt in the Name column (the folder path is ../hive/warehouse/hivesampletable/), and then click Binary on the left of HiveSampleData.txt.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>HDI.PowerQuery.ImportData</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>HDI.PowerQuery.ImportData</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want, you can rename the column names. When you are ready, click Apply & Close.
trans-unit.target: If you want, you can rename the column names. When you are ready, click Apply & Close.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>HDI.PowerQuery.ImportedTable</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>HDI.PowerQuery.ImportedTable</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Next steps
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Next steps

trans-unit.source: In this article, you learned how to use Power Query to retrieve data from HDInsight into Excel.
trans-unit.target: In this article, you learned how to use Power Query to retrieve data from HDInsight into Excel.

trans-unit.source: Similarly, you can retrieve data from HDInsight into Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: Similarly, you can retrieve data from HDInsight into Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: It is also possible to upload data into HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: It is also possible to upload data into HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: To learn more, see the following articles:
trans-unit.target: To learn more, see the following articles:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Connect Excel to HDInsight with the Microsoft Hive ODBC Driver[hdinsight-odbc]</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Connect Excel to HDInsight with the Microsoft Hive ODBC Driver[hdinsight-odbc]</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Upload Data to HDInsight[hdinsight-upload-data]</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Upload Data to HDInsight[hdinsight-upload-data]</linkText><title></title></link>
